meanings.definition: To place in a new or different position.
meanings.sent1: She is resituating the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The workers are resituating the furniture in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The cat is resituating the toy mouse around the room.
meanings.sent4: The wind resituating the fallen leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent5: He resituates his books on the shelf every week.

meanings.definition: To move to a new location or position.
meanings.sent1: The family is resituating to a new house next month.
meanings.sent2: The students are resituating to different seats in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel is resituating its nuts to a safer spot.
meanings.sent4: The clouds resituate themselves across the sky.
meanings.sent5: She resituates her plants to get more sunlight.
